Award.AbstractNarration:
A Data Science Innovation Lab workshop, "Quantitative Approaches to Biomedical Data Science Challenges in Our Understanding of the Microbiome", will be held at the Wylie Inn and Conference Center, Boston, MA, June 19-23, 2017. (See http://www.bigdatau.org/innovationlab2017/.) The Innovation Lab will bring together early-career biomedical and quantitative investigators to engage in intensive multidisciplinary interactions, with a goal of developing new and bold approaches to address data science challenges involving the microbiome.

The 2017 Innovation Lab will focus on novel approaches for analyzing high-dimensional big data derived from microbiota associated with a health or biomedical research objective. While many approaches have been applied to identify and explore interactions and potential causal relationships between the human microbiome and the health of the human host, mechanistic modeling of gut interactions largely remains an unfulfilled goal. New mathematical frameworks, analytic tools and computational models will allow for a deeper quantitative understanding of these mechanisms, leading to improved treatment of microbiome-related illness. Funds from this award will support travel for participants to attend the workshop.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project requested funding for the 2016 Data Science Innovation Lab on Interdisciplinary Approaches to Biomedical Data Science: Rural Health and Environmental Exposures.  The Innovation Lab entails participation in an intensive five-day residential workshop in order to facilitate the development of new teams of early-career biomedical and quantitative investigators who generate multidisciplinary cooperative research programs through a real-time and iterative mentoring process.  Held at the Graylyn Estate in Winston-Salem, North Carolina in June 2019, the goal of the Innovation Lab is to foster new interdisciplinary collaborations among quantitative and biomedical researchers to address data science challenges specific to rural health where environmental exposures to polutants, industrial waste, changes in climate, agricultural practices, etc, make them particularly susceptible to health concerns. Rural health, as defined here, broadly describes the broad impacts of health concerns in communities having limited access to health care, where data modeling is needed to shape health policy, and/or where catalysts to diseases are poorly understood. Data science provides numerous unique opportunities for geo-spatial modeling, time series analyses,  Upon the conclusion of the Data Science Innovation Lab, inter-disciplinary teams of data and biomedical scientists will have developed, presented, and begun the process of undertaking a set of new innovative research projects.
